CHAT.comment: Chi jumps right into writing the letter , without re-reading the book. While he is writing the header of the letter , MOT and EXP talk about other things. Chi must take some time to think about the content of the letter , because at one point Mot becomes impatient and prods Chi to hurry the writing the process. When Chi asks for help on his spelling , MOT reacts impatiently and half-jokes that she is the one who will end up writing the letter. Mot seems to relax after that , however , and Chi finishes up his one-sentence letter , while EXP and she continue to talk. Chi reads his finished product , which leads into a discussion on books he likes to read. Mot and Chi seem to have a good relationship overall , and Chi seems like a very good-natured child.

u.a: inferring to Mot that he needs help spelling
MOT refers to the stenciling she did on the living room walls the night before
MOT's fingernails are covered with paint or marker because she was stenciling the living rooms walls the night before
speaking as if she's Eric Carle
talking from a distance , as if he is coming in from another room
made-up word for the horse who wants to go home most
